subject: Re: How to create data-driven tests?
msgSnippet: We found that we had to extend junit.framework.TestSetup to provide for: Ability to read test parameters from (multiple) .properties files Ability for a test
messageBody:
We found that we had to extend junit.framework.TestSetup to provide
for:
Ability to read test parameters from (multiple) .properties files
Ability for a test to retrieve test parameters based on a key name
Ability to log test output with user/iteration-specific prefixes
Ability to run tests repeatedly, and concurrently in separate threads

The properties file can specify the names of data sets to use, for
example:
test1.dataset=sashelp.class
test1.column=name
test1.row=1
test1.data=Sally

test2.dataset=sashelp.air
test2.column=air
test2.row=4
test2.data=150

In a testSomething() method, we would use our getProperties() to
obtain the values for the "test1" properties. In a testSomething2()
method, we'd use the "test2" properties.


Here is invoking a test with two parameter files (one on disk, one in
a JAR):

java -
DtestInfo=c:\testing\myconnection.properties,com.sastest.someOtherFile
.properties junit.swingui.TestRunner
com.sastest.sasserver.librarylist.LibraryListTest

-tcfolsom SAS, Cary, NC
